item.title: 诺贝尔经济学奖授予莫基尔、阿吉翁和豪威特
item.description: 来自大西洋两岸的三位学者将分享 2025 年诺贝尔经济学奖，以表彰他们在创新促进经济发展方面所做的工作。【原文：Three academics from both sides of the Atlantic will share the 2025 Nobel Prize for economics for their work on the role of innovation in generating economic expansion.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势唤醒逆市微盘股
item.description: 几个月来，美国股市中最微小、投机性最强的股票的投资者一直在追随市场的涨势。然而，市场信心的岌岌可危却残酷地提醒了他们。【原文：Investors in the tiniest, most speculative US stocks were riding a market-beating rally for months. Then they got a harsh reminder of just how tenuous market confidence can be.】

item.title: Lenskart和Billionbrains将为印度本月创纪录的首次公开募股画上句号
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，眼镜零售商 Lenskart Solutions Ltd. 和金融服务公司 Billionbrains Garage Ventures Ltd. 将于本月晚些时候通过首次公开募股募集合计 17 亿美元的资金，为印度的股票上市潮再添新军。【原文：Eyewear retailer Lenskart Solutions Ltd. and financial services firm Billionbrains Garage Ventures Ltd. are set to raise a combined $1.7 billion via initial public offerings later this month, people familiar with the matter said, adding to India’s deluge of stock listings.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司首席执行官称新兴国家石油需求依然强劲
item.description: 沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco）首席执行官表示，在发展中国家增长的带动下，今明两年全球石油需求将保持 "强劲"。【原文：Global oil demand looks set to stay “robust” this year and next, led by growth in developing nations, according to the chief executive of Saudi Aramco.】

item.title: 中国股市跌势被遏制，"买入跌势 "呼声渐高
item.description: 面对不断升级的贸易紧张局势，中国市场表现出了令人惊讶的韧性，凸显出投资者已对华盛顿和北京之间针锋相对的炮火习以为常。【原文：Chinese markets displayed surprising resilience in the face of escalating trade tensions, underscoring how investors have grown accustomed to tit-for-tat salvos between Washington and Beijing.】

item.title: 穆迪下调信用评级后塞内加尔债券收益率飙升
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）警告说，西非国家可能需要重组债务的风险越来越大，此后塞内加尔美元债券收益率跳升。【原文：Yields on Senegalese dollar bonds jumped after Moody’s Ratings warned there’s a growing risk that the West African nation may need to restructure its debt.】

item.title: 印尼与美国讨论辐射恐慌后的出口认证问题
item.description: 在美国食品和药物管理局在从东南亚国家运出的冷冻虾和丁香中检测出微量铯-137 后，印度尼西亚正在与美国就无放射性货物认证问题敲定一份谅解备忘录。【原文：Indonesia is finalizing a memorandum of understanding with the US on certification for radioactive-free cargoes after the US Food and Drug Administration detected trace amounts of cesium-137 in frozen shrimp and cloves shipped from Southeast Asian nation.】

item.title: 卢比的异常平静助长了对印度央行收紧控制的猜测
item.description: 印度卢比在过去三周内几乎没有波动，这促使一些交易商猜测印度央行正在再次收紧对货币的控制。【原文：India’s rupee has barely budged over the past three weeks, prompting some traders to speculate that the central bank is once again tightening its grip on the currency.】

item.title: 特朗普与 TikTok 的交易让白宫掌握了主动权
item.description:
有史以来最独特的商业安排之一可能会让政府对 TikTok 的关键决策拥有决定权，从而为加强社交媒体上的党派纷争开辟另一条途径。【原文：

One of the most unique business arrangements of all time could give the administration sway over key decisions at TikTok, creating another avenue to ramp up partisanship on social media.

】

item.title: 贸易谈判取得进展，印度称贸易团队本周将访问美国
item.description: 一位官员周一在新德里告诉记者，印度贸易代表团将于本周访问美国，两国将努力在秋季最后期限前达成一项协议。【原文：An Indian trade delegation will visit the US this week as the two nations work toward clinching a deal by the fall deadline, an official told reporters in New Delhi on Monday.】

item.title: 云顶集团竞购马来西亚私有化部门
item.description: 根据周一提交给证券交易所的一份文件，马来西亚云顶集团（Genting Bhd）已提出收购要约，将其马来西亚分公司云顶马来西亚有限公司（Genting Malaysia Bhd）私有化。【原文：Malaysia’s Genting Bhd has made a takeover bid to privatize its Malaysian unit Genting Malaysia Bhd, according to a stock exchange filing on Monday.】

item.title: 土耳其旅游业和贸易使经常账户盈余创历史新高
item.description: 由于旅游业收入和贸易逆差缩小促进了资金流入，土耳其 8 月份的经常账户盈余创下历史新高，暂时缓解了该国的外部财政状况。【原文：Turkey posted a record current-account surplus in August as tourism revenues and a narrower trade gap boosted inflows, offering temporary relief to the country’s external finances.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利的威尔逊称贸易战可能导致 S&P 500 指数下跌 11
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的迈克尔-威尔逊（Michael Wilson）表示，如果中美之间的贸易紧张局势不能在 11 月的最后期限之前得到解决，美股将面临下挫高达 11% 的风险。【原文：US stocks are at risk of sinking as much as 11% if trade tensions between the US and China aren’t resolved before a November deadline, according to Morgan Stanley’s Michael Wilson.】

item.title: Blackstone 考虑竞购英国仓储业主 Big Yellow
item.description: Blackstone Inc 正在权衡对英国仓储业主 Big Yellow Group Plc 的收购要约。【原文：Blackstone Inc is weighing an offer for UK storage landlord Big Yellow Group Plc.】

item.title: 中美运费争执不下，航运业面临 "巨大混乱
item.description: 杰富瑞公司（Jefferies LLC）称，如果中国针对美国船只征收的港口费于周二生效，油轮和集装箱船将受到最严重的冲击。【原文：Oil tankers and container ships will be among the hardest hit should China’s port fees targeting US vessels take effect on Tuesday, according to Jefferies LLC.】

item.title: 安德鲁-罗斯-索金谈震撼美国的股市崩盘
item.description:
1929年的教训。【原文：

Lessons from 1929.

】

item.title: 奇货可居：索金谈震撼美国的大崩盘（播客）
item.description: 几乎所有人都在谈论我们可能正处于泡沫之中。无论人工智能投资最终结果如何，空气中都弥漫着令人难以置信的零售投机狂热。那么，这种环境与过去的繁荣时期相比如何呢？在本期节目中，我们将采访《Dealbook》杂志编辑、CNBC "Squawk Box "节目联合主持人、新书《1929：1929: Inside the Greatest Crash in Wall Street History—and How It Shattered a Nation》一书的作者。索金曾【原文：Almost everyone is talking about us possibly being in a bubble. Regardless of how AI investment ultimately pan out, there is an incredible amount of retail speculative mania in the air. So, how does this environment compare to past periods of exuberance? On this episode, we speak with Andrew Ross Sorkin, the editor of Dealbook, the co-host of CNBC’s Squawk Box, and the author of the new book 1929: Inside the Greatest Crash in Wall Street History—and How It Shattered a Nation. Sorkin, who previou】

item.title: 金融稳定委员会警告稳定币和私人金融的新威胁
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）誓言要加强全球政策应对措施，以应对来自私人金融和稳定币使用日益增长的新威胁。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey has vowed to intensify the global policy response to emerging threats from private finance and the growing use of stablecoins.】

item.title: 迪拜邻国沙迦寻求首次人民币贷款，与中国关系日益密切
item.description: 随着中东实体越来越多地向亚洲银行寻求资金，阿拉伯联合酋长国的一个地方政府即将获得有史以来第一笔人民币银团贷款。【原文：A local government from the United Arab Emirates is close to securing its first-ever Chinese yuan-denominated syndicated loan, as Middle Eastern entities increasingly turn to Asian banks for funding.】

item.title: 中国飞行汽车有望成为海湾天空的最新奇迹
item.description: 在迪拜这个对令人瞠目结舌的景象并不陌生的城市，中国制造的飞行汽车盘旋在迪拜最华丽的海滩度假胜地上空，仍然让人目不暇接。【原文：In a city that’s no stranger to jaw-dropping sights, the Chinese-made flying car hovering over one of Dubai’s glitziest beach resorts still turned heads.】

item.title: 法国 Canal+ 将在南非上市，计划交易额达 30 亿美元
item.description: Canal+ 正在推进其在南非证券交易所二次上市的计划，因为法国集团已完全控制了多选择集团有限公司（MultiChoice Group Ltd.）。【原文：Canal+ is moving ahead with its plans for a secondary inward listing on South Africa’s bourse as the French group takes full control of the MultiChoice Group Ltd.】

item.title: 尽管避开了美国，中国九月份大豆进口量仍创纪录
item.description: 中国 9 月份的大豆进口量创下历史新高，尽管在农业大国之间的贸易紧张局势再度加剧之际，中国仍在避免美国的大豆供应。【原文：China’s soybean imports hit a record high for the month of September, even as the country avoids US supplies amid a resurgence in trade tensions between the agriculture powerhouses.】

item.title: 美国制裁中国油港威胁中石化削减运行费用
item.description: 美国对中国一个重要石油进口码头的制裁正在改变原油流向，并威胁到几家国有炼油厂的减产。【原文：US sanctions on a key Chinese oil import terminal are redirecting crude flows and threatening run cuts at several state-owned refineries.】

item.title: 英国富时 100 指数将反弹，英镑维持在 1.33 美元上方
小米股价暴跌，原因是有报道称电动汽车坠毁导致人员被困车内
item.description: 据报道，小米公司的 SU7 电动轿车在中国西南城市成都发生起火事故后，其中一扇车门未能打开，车内至少有一人被困，小米公司股价创下 4 月以来最大跌幅。【原文：Xiaomi Corp. shares fell the most since April after reports that one of its SU7 electric sedan’s doors failed to open after a fiery crash in the southwest Chinese city of Chengdu, trapping at least one person inside.】

item.title: 花旗、摩根大通看好中国价值股，称其为关税风险下的避风港
item.description: 策略师们认为，中美贸易紧张局势的最新激化是投资者将配置转向中国股市中相对便宜的防御性板块的理由。【原文：The latest flare-up in Sino-American trade tensions is reason for investors to shift allocation toward the relatively cheaper and defensive corners of the Chinese stock market, according to strategists.】

item.title: 韩国罕见表示关注韩元单边波动
item.description: 韩国进行了罕见的口头干预，当局表示他们正在关注货币的单边走势。【原文：South Korea gave a rare verbal intervention, with authorities saying they are watching for one-sided moves in the currency.】

item.title: 中美争端加剧供应担忧，稀土类股反弹
item.description: 稀土类股票延续了近期的涨势，原因是北京与华盛顿之间就中国出口稀土的问题再次出现紧张局势，推动了对替代供应商的押注。【原文：Rare earth stocks extended recent gains as fresh tensions between Beijing and Washington over China’s exports of the critical minerals fueled bets on alternative suppliers.】

item.title: 帝国反击战下一部是《太哥归来》吗？
item.description:
中国握有更多的牌。但到目前为止，对特朗普有利的是，债券市场并不'yippy'。【原文：

China holds more cards. But in Trump’s favor so far, bond markets aren’t ‘yippy.’ 

】

item.title: 中国铁矿石、铜和煤炭进口量升至年度新高
item.description: 中国的大宗商品采购量在 9 月份普遍转高，原因是买方为满足秋季工业需求的正常增长而备货。【原文：China’s commodities purchases broadly turned higher in September as buyers stocked up to meet the usual rise in industrial demand during the autumn months.】
